reviewText: Lovely welsh voice of Richard Burton, all the gorgeous imagery of Dylan Thomas' poetry.
This is a must have for night owls who want something to listen to and watch; Burton's wonderful voice and the animated, most humorous drawings belong in your library.

This is a useful introduction to the radio play for students who find it difficult to visualize the play for themselves. It has more moments of real imagination than the poor very literal live action version with Burton and the badly miscast Elizabeth Taylor.
The beautiful language of Dylan Thomas with good cartoons. A pleasure to watch, a pleasure to listen to.
